summary: All three Flatline integrations (duration estimates, explicit e2e workspace project, and gate failure handling) are internally consistent with the existing plan, don’t conflict with the runner-based E2E execution, and no acceptance criteria appear removed or materially altered.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Integration tests require Redis, but plan didn’t specify local/CI Redis provisioning or REDIS_URL wiring
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed: Task 1.1 continues to specify local Redis options and CI redis service + REDIS_URL wiring.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: E2E runner criteria didn’t specify how E2E tests are invoked / tied to test:e2e script
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed: Task 1.1 maps pnpm test:e2e to run-e2e.sh, and Task 2.1 pins the vitest invocation and zero-test discovery failure behavior.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: JWKS/JWT validation might violate “zero new application logic” if stub changes aren’t allowed
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed: Task 2.3 scope note explicitly allows tests/e2e/* harness changes while forbidding production package changes.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Static egress assertion via /proc/net/tcp was underspecified and likely infeasible/flaky
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed: Task 2.5 retains the concrete parsing/allowlist algorithm and determinism proof AC.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Static import guard was too narrow (directory scope + only ESM import style)
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed: Task 1.5 continues to cover all workspace test dirs and ESM/CJS/dynamic patterns with a regression-proof AC.
